August 27, 1952
Dr. Wilbur Schramm
Lean
School of Communications
University of Illinois
Urbane, Illinois
Dear Vlilburi
Enclosed you will find a copy of the letter being sent to members of
the Board. I should be very grateful for your confidential reaction to
the points raised, as well as any suggestions you mpy have for people.
I assure you your letter will be kept strictly confidential, unless you
wish it to be otherwise.
I shall talk to Bob VanDuyn as soon as X can catch him to let him
know where we stand aid to get his reaction to some of the problems raised
in this letter.
A rehash of all of the matters which we discussed by telephone last
Saturday is not necessary. I should like to repeat, however, that the
sentiments expressed in the letter we discussed were a reflection of only
one personâ€™s views aid his thinking was changed considerably at the Ames
meeting. I am genuinely sorry that it happened and can assure you there
will be no repetition of that or of the situation that developed at
Battle Creek. The one other point I should like to raise is that of your
relationship between N/EB and the Kellogg Foundation. I sincerely hope that
you will change your mind about letting someone else do this job which you
have done magnificently. This is the feeling of every member of the Board.
The same is true of the permanence of the Headquarters operation at the
University of Illinois. The one change of the Executive Director is enough.
Further changes would be psychologically very harmful to the organl zation.
Hgr very kindest regards always.
Sincerely yours.
GA/ns
